description: Overview on RD3 Subjects, samples, and experiments
An individual who is the subject of personal data, persons to whom data refers, and from whom data are collected, processed, and stored.
Claimed Sex / Sex at birth (can be different from observed sex, see sample)
A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.
Identifier indicating a reference to mother of the subject
Identifier indicating a reference to father of the subject
One or more Solve-RD releases that indicate when the record was first introduced into RD3 or when it was updated.
If true, this subject does not have data in any data freeze (1,2,3,etc.)
Name of the organisation that submitted Subject
whether it is an affected individual (main disease) Yes/No
Phenotype based on Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO)
Relevant Phenotype NOT present in subject
if affected, which MAIN disease code(s) apply to subject
Number of samples derived from a subject
All samples derived from a subject
